thread.title: Howard Webb hits out at "nasty" Joey Barton incident and says the Burnley midfielder could face a suspension
thread.title_full: Howard Webb hits out at "nasty" Joey Barton incident and says the Burnley midfielder could face a suspension

author: Jake Polden
title: Howard Webb hits out at "nasty" Joey Barton incident and says the Burnley midfielder could face a suspension
text:
Sport Howard Webb hits out at "nasty" Joey Barton incident and says the Burnley midfielder could face a suspension The former Premier League referee accused Barton of "putting nails in the face" of the Lincoln City winger Share Joey Barton was involved in a couple of controversial moments on Saturday (Photo: REUTERS)   Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Howard Webb says Joey Barton could face a suspension for "putting nails in the face" of a Lincoln City player in Burnley's FA Cup fifth round defeat. 
The Clarets midfielder was involved in a couple of controversial moments as the conference outfit beat the Premier League side 1-0 at Turf Moor. 
In the second half, Barton appeared to scratch the face of Terry Hawkridge as the two players came together following a challenge for the ball. 
The 34-year-old was booked for his part in the clash, but replays appeared to show the 34-year-old digging his nails into the Lincoln winger's face, suggesting he was lucky to see yellow. Howard Webb says Joey Barton could face a suspension (Photo: BT Sport) 
Speaking on BT Sport following the game, Webb was asked for his thoughts on the incident and called Barton's actions "nasty". 
He added: "Joey lost his discipline. He puts his hand out to Hawkridge. When you see it again, he puts his nails into his face." 
The former Premier League referee also spoke about the retrospective action Barton may be hit with as a result of the incident, and suggested he could be suspended. 
This was not the only controversial moment from the match involving Barton. Barton picked up a booking in Burnley's 1-0 defeat to Lincoln City (Photo: REUTERS) Barton holds his face after going down in the FA Cup fifth round tie (Photo: Clive Brunskill) 
The midfielder, who appeared to stamp on the foot of Matt Rhead earlier in the game, immediately ran behind the striker and apparently made contact with his hand. 
He then dropped to the floor in dramatic fashion while clutching his face, as if trying to get the striker cautioned or sent off. Fortunately nothing came of the incident. 
Barton took to Twitter after the game to attempt to explain what happened. poll loading Should Joey Barton have been sent off? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
